Title: Kommander: Insecure remote script execution
Synopsis:
Kommander executes remote scripts without confirmation, potentially
    resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

Background.Text: KDE is a feature-rich graphical desktop environment for Linux and Unix-like Operating Systems. Kommander is a visual dialog editor and interpreter for KDE applications, part of the kdewebdev package.

Description.Text: Kommander executes data files from possibly untrusted locations without user confirmation.

Impact.Text: An attacker could exploit this to execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running Kommander.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All kdewebdev users should upgrade to the latest version:

URI.Text: KDE Security Advisory: Kommander untrusted code execution
